meanings.definition: To impose a new sentence on someone who has already been sentenced.
meanings.sent1: The judge decided to re-sentence the criminal for his actions.
meanings.sent2: After new evidence was found, they had to re-sentence the defendant.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom was filled with tension as the judge announced the resentencing.
meanings.sent4: The decision to re-sentence the convict was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The act of resentencing brought closure to the victim's family.

meanings.definition: To revise or change a previously given sentence.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer requested to resentence the terms of the agreement.
meanings.sent2: It is common for authors to resentence their work multiple times before publishing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to resentence the assignment after realizing the mistake.
meanings.sent4: She carefully resentenced her response to make it more clear.
meanings.sent5: The editor had to resentence the paragraph to improve the flow of the article.
